title: An edited photo shared as Pakistan people holding a banner - 'We don't want Kashmir. Give us Hydroxychloroquine'
subtitle: Photo shared as Pakistan people holding a banner with the text – ‘We don’t want Kashmir. Give us Hydroxychloroquine’ is an old photoshopped image.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A photo is being shared widely on social media with a claim that Pakistan people are holding a banner with the text – ‘We don’t want Kashmir. Give us Hydroxychloroquine’. FACTLY has found that it is an edited photo. In the original picture, it can be seen that the people are holding a banner with the text – ‘We want Azaadi’. Also, the photo was taken in Kashmir. When the similar edited image went viral in another context, FACTLY has written a fact-check article, which can be read here.

There are some media reports claiming that Pakistan has asked India for Hydroxychloroquine supplies, which can be read here and here. FACTLY could not independently verify the claim.

Did you watch our new video?
